synopsis: char* asctime_r( const struct tm* timeptr,

parameters.name: timeptr
parameters.description:
A pointer to a tm structure that contains the time
  that you want to convert to a string.

parameters.name: buf
parameters.description:
(asctime_r() only)
  A buffer in which asctime_r() can store the resulting string.
  This buffer must be large enough to hold at least 26 characters.

full_content:
Function: asctime_r
URL: https://www.qnx.com/developers/docs/7.1/com.qnx.doc.neutrino.lib_ref/topic/a/asctime.html
Synopsis: char* asctime_r( const struct tm* timeptr,
Headers: #include <time.h>
Parameters:
  - timeptr: A pointer to a tm structure that contains the time
  that you want to convert to a string.
  - buf: (asctime_r() only)
  A buffer in which asctime_r() can store the resulting string.
  This buffer must be large enough to hold at least 26 characters.
Examples:
Example 1:
#include <time.h>

char* asctime( const struct tm* timeptr );

char* asctime_r( const struct tm* timeptr, 
                 char* buf );
